intro: Spermacoce virginiana, commonly known as the Virgin's wheel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is an annual herb that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils such as roadsides and woodland edges. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of its branches. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release its seeds. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
